name: eSchool SaaS - School Management System with Student | Parents Flutter App | Laravel Admin Panel
short-description: It is a SaaS-based school management system that allows you to manage your school's information, students, parents, and teachers. It is designed to be user-friendly and easy to use, with a modern and responsive interface that provides all the necessary features for school administrators to manage their school effectively.
full-description: It has two mobile applications, a web panel, a SaaS website, and a school website.
One application is for Students & Parents and another for Teachers, Staff, and School Admin.
Super admin, School admin, Teachers, and Staff will use the web panel.
Students and Parents will use the Student & Parent mobile app.
Teachers, Staff, and School Admin will use the Teacher & Staff mobile app.
The SaaS website will be used by the general public to learn about the system and its services.
The School website will be used by the general public to learn about the school and other activities.
Super admin (SaaS Owner) can create various types of packages based on given features and provide them to schools. School admin will subscribe to the packages and get access to the features.
technology-used: Flutter (Dart) - To build the mobile apps
Laravel (PHP) - To build the web panel and APIs
MySQL - To store the data (relational database)
HTML, CSS, JavaScript - To build the web panel, SaaS website, and School website
prerequisites: Stripe account (if you want to use Stripe)
Razorpay account (if you want to use Razorpay)
VPS or Dedicated Server with minimum 2 core CPU and root database access
Google Play Console account (if you want to publish the app on Google Play Store)
Apple Store account (if you want to publish the app on Apple Store)

about-author.name: WRTeam
about-author.description: WRTeam has designed and developed this SaaS application. WRTeam has the copyright of this script

authentication.information: The default email and password for super admin are superadmin@gmail.com and 'superadmin', respectively. These can be changed later.

information: Super admin can create various types of packages based on given features and provide them to schools. School admin will subscribe to the packages and get access to the features.
There are a total of 20 features that can be added to the packages. Out of these, 4 features are default. The remaining 16 features can be used to create various packages.
Each package can be subscribed to by multiple schools. So, the Super admin can create multiple packages for different schools.
There are two types of packages: prepaid and postpaid.
To create a prepaid package, the Super admin will need to provide the following information: Name, Description, Tagline, Days, Number of Active Students, Number of Active Staff, Charges or Price.
To create a postpaid package, the Super admin will need to provide the following information: Name, Description, Tagline, Days, Per Active Student Charge, Per Active Staff Charge.
While creating a prepaid or postpaid package, the Super admin can highlight the package. If marked as a highlight, it will be shown on the SaaS website.
Default features: Academics Management, Session Year Management, Student Management, Session Year Management.

16 additional features that can be added: Announcement Management, Assignment Management, Attendance Management, Chat Module, Exam Management, Expense Management, Fees Management, Holiday Management, ID Card - Certificate Generation, Lesson Management, School Gallery Management, Slider Management, Staff Leave Management, Staff Management, Timetable Management, Website Management.

questions.title: How to create a package?
answers: You can create a package by clicking on the 'Add Package' button.

questions.title: What is 'Per Active Student Charge'?
answers: 'Per Active Student Charge' means we will charge only for active students.

questions.title: What is 'Per Active Staff Charge'?
answers: The 'Per Active Staff Charge' means we will charge only for active staff members.

questions.title: How does the pricing model work for packages?
answers: The pricing model is based on the number of active students and staff members, calculated as per the charges set in the package.

questions.title: Can I edit or delete a package after creating it?
answers: Yes, you can edit or delete a package by navigating to the package management section and selecting the desired package.

questions.title: What is SaaS?
answers: SaaS (Software as a Service) is a software model where the application is provided as a service to users, rather than being installed and maintained on their own devices.

school-management.information: School admins can manage student enrollment, attendance, exams, and academic records.

add-ons.information: Additional features can be purchased separately to enhance the school management experience.

faqs.information: Created FAQs are reflected on the advertisement page.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Thank you for using e-School SaaS. This document provides an overview of super admin features and their functionalities. All fields marked with (*) are mandatory. Deleted data is first moved to the trash, from where it can be restored or permanently deleted.

sections.title: Features
content: Student Management
Academics Management
Slider Management
Teacher Management
Session Year Management
Holiday Management
Timetable Management
Attendance Management
Exam Management
Lesson Management
Assignment Management
Announcement Management
Staff Management
Expense Management
Staff Leave Management
Fees Management
School Gallery Management
ID Card - Certificate Generation
Website Management
Chat Module
sections.note: There are 20 features in this system. Out of these, 16 are used for package building. The default 4 features are: Student Management, Academics Management, Teacher Management, and Session Year Management.

sections.title: Authentication
sections.content: The default email and password for super admin are superadmin@gmail.com and 'superadmin', respectively. These can be changed later.

sections.title: Dashboard
sections.content: Provides an overview of the system's status and key metrics.

sections.title: Schools
content: Super Admin can create schools and assign school admins. The default password for a school admin is their phone number.
Packages can be selected during school registration, with the start date matching the registration date.
Super Admin can modify or delete school and admin details.
Packages can be assigned to schools without active ones.
Schools can be activated or deactivated. Deactivated schools prevent students and staff from logging in.

sections.title: Packages
content: Default features included are Student Management, Academics Management, Teacher Management, and Session Year Management. Additional features can be added.
In prepaid packages, admins can limit the number of active students and staff. In postpaid packages, per active student and staff charges can be set.
New packages are unpublished by default. Only published packages are visible to schools.
Highlighted packages appear on the advertisement page.
All subscriptions are auto-renewable by default.
Package updates (e.g., pricing, features) affect the next billing cycle.
Package rankings can be adjusted by dragging them up or down; schools see packages based on rank.
Duration updates to packages apply only to new subscriptions.
Feature updates can be applied instantly to all subscribed schools at the Super Admin's discretion.

sections.title: Add-ons
content: Super Admin can create add-ons for all features except the 4 default ones. New add-ons are unpublished by default.
Price updates to add-ons take effect in the next billing cycle.

sections.title: Subscription
content: Super Admin can extend the billing payment date for any school. Once the date has passed, it cannot be modified.
Current plans for schools can be updated. Changing a package immediately terminates the current one and starts the new package.
Bills can be generated manually if the system fails to do so.
Offline payments for school subscriptions can be managed.

sections.title: Subscription Transaction
sections.content: Super Admin can view all transactions made by schools.

sections.title: Role Permissions
sections.content: Dynamic roles can be created as needed. Reserved roles include Super Admin, School Admin, Teacher, Guardian, and Student.

sections.title: Staff
content: Support staff can log in using their email and default password (their phone number).
Support staff can be assigned to multiple schools. Schools have access to their support staff details.

sections.title: Email Schools
sections.content: Super Admin can send customized emails to schools, including updates, notifications, and announcements.

sections.title: FAQs
sections.content: Created FAQs are reflected on the advertisement page.

sections.title: General Settings
content: Manage colors, banner images, 'About Us', footer, and other content of the landing page.
Schools see package amounts in the entered currency.

sections.title: Feature Sections
sections.content: Manage highlighted features of the system.

sections.title: App Settings
content: App version number must follow the pattern 1.0.0+1 (e.g., 1.0.1+2, 1.1.0+15).
If force update is enabled, users must update the app to continue using it. Ensure iOS and Android app versions are added before enabling force update.
Force update works by comparing the app version from the super admin panel with the user's installed app version. If the admin panel version is greater, the user is prompted to update.

sections.title: Subscription Settings
content: Additional billing days provide extra time after package expiration for schools to pay the bill (minimum value is 1).
Minimum value for current plan expiry warning days is 1.
Cron job URL is essential to ensure smooth package activation and billing.

sections.title: Front Site (Advertisement Page) Settings
sections.content: Manage the content and appearance of the front-facing advertisement page.

sections.title: Language Settings
content: Languages added here are reflected in the web panel's app bar.
A downloadable .json file is available for adding necessary language data. Ensure keys are not modified. (RTL means Right to Left.)

sections.title: Notification Settings
content: Add Firebase project ID and service file from the Firebase console to enhance security and functionality.

sections.title: Email Configuration
content: Requires SMTP credentials: Mailer, Host, Port, Email Address, Encryption, Send From (same as Email Address).
Email verification is used to verify SMTP credentials. If correct, a test email is sent; otherwise, an appropriate error is provided.
